Name: How Do I Unlock Bozja?
Info: Bozja is unlocked by first completing the <LINK> questline.
Once Return to Ivalice is completed you can begin the quest <LINK>.

Name: How Do I Increase My Rank?
Info: Do Skirmishes and Critical Engagements.
Killing enemies outside of Skirmishes and CEs yields 0 mettle.

Name: What is the best gear in Bozja?
Info: Stats are set in Bozja, not synced, so any gear works. Just make sure to have something equipped. Emperor's gear and level 90 BiS are the same!
The only exception to this is the Augmented Bozjan and Augmented Laws Order gear which gives haste in Bozja zones.
This haste bonus is nice but is by no means required for any content.

Name: How Do I Get Lost Actions?
Info: Lost Actions are obtained via Forgotten Fragments. Most fragments are obtained from overworld enemies though some come from other sources.
You can use the Fragment Map feature to help find the fragment you are looking for.
Here is a guide on farming fragments as well: <LINK>

Name: How Do I Get Bozjan Clusters?
Info: Clusters have a chance of dropping from any 4th Legion enemies.
Here is a guide on farming clusters as well: <LINK>

Name: Is it ok to do Castrum with 5 people?
Info: Yes, CLL scales to the number of players. I would only suggest not going in with 4 or less players.
If you want more technical numbers check out this <LINK>.

Name: Why is nobody queuing for Delubrum?
Info: Delubrum Reginae (DRN) is entirely managed via the Party Finder feature.
DRN also has a required 10 minute queue for parties less than 24 so don't be concerned if it takes a bit to get in.

Name: How do I deal damage in Bozja?
Info: If you are in BSF or Zadnor <LINK>.
If you are in Delubrum Reginae <LINK>.

Name: What do Resistance Honors give?
Info: Ray of Valor: +3% Damage per stack
Ray of Fortitude: +5% HP per stack
Ray of Succor: +10% Healing per stack

Name: Do people still play Bozja content?
Info: Yes. If there are very few people in instance you are probably playing during more quiet hours.
On NA servers, BSF and Zadnor are most active during the evenings in the US.
